ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to prepare a musical theater song, how to act with authenticity, and how to have confidence presenting myself.

I developed skills as a musical theater performer -- I learned how to approach any new song with a set of hard skills that can be applied to any future performance.

I also learned a lot about how to navigate the mental journey that is performing and being a creative.
I learned how to organize and execute my process for researching, practicing, and adjusting my performance of musical theater numbers.
I feel I greatly developed as a performer! I found a new way of approaching material and creating a solid foundation for training on my own time.
Became much more secure in myself as a performer. Worked on my method for learning a new song and learned how to bring the best parts of myself into every performance.
I really gained a greater confidence in myself as well as the hard skills to dissect a song. Andra was also so wonderfully supportive that I felt I could fully and freely engage with the material.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Andrea Burns is phenomenal. She creates such a nurturing environment where people feel comfortable truly exploring and taking risks.

Weaknesses: The Friday timeslot is a bit difficult. 

I really don't have anything in mind that would improve the course -- it has been my favorite at Yale so far.

Strengths are definitely Professor Burns' weekly assignments -- the readings and process journals were great for compartmentalizing my anxieties about perfection and for keeping tabs on my own progress, respectively.

Strengths are the supportive community. Going to class was just a great way to end each week and it was really nice to be part of such a supportive group. Other strengths were the group discussions we had at the end of some classes. It was a great way to put our experience into words and hear what everyone's journey has been. Also, Professor Burns was very supportive of everyone and made the classroom feel open and safe! One weakness is pace. The first half of the class felt very slow and tedious, but was probably necessary  in order to gain everything we did in the second half of the class. You gotta trust the process.
I thought everyone was so supportive and loved the different styles we covered. I also loved the readings we did.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! I would absolutely recommend this course to someone interested in musical theater (especially as a living) or performance in general.
I would absolutely recommend this course to another student looking to improve their performance preparation process.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. It is such a privilege to be taught by someone who not only cares so much about their craft, but cares about educating those who also intend to pursue the craft. I feel like there was much knowledge and wisdom to be gained.

Yes! Taking this course with Professor Burns was a learning experience I didn't know I needed. While I didn't necessarily feel like I was challenged as an actor in this class, I feel like I was able to really settle into who I am as a performer and learn how I bring what I have to the table in every performance. These lessons are just as important to grow as a person and actor, and is something that is definitely lacking in the rest of Yale theater. I feel so much more confident in myself after this course and feel like I gained a mindset that will be extremely helpful as I move forward in my acting career. Take this course!
Most definitely! No matter how much experience you have in theater, this is the class to learn about yourself and performance.
